Description: Papyrus (mounted in 6 frames) written with black ink with demotic legal text on recto (10 cols., each of 24-26 ll. except the last of 19 ll.) and verso (7 cols. of varying size). Thompson's MS Catalogue (referring to the whole papyrus): "recto: the proceedings of a native court of justice consisting of three priests with a Greek assessor in a civil suit arising out of the document no. 10575 supra. verso: copies of documents relating to the text of the recto. Date year 11 Pachons 21 of Ptolemy Philometor = BC. 170 June 23". Here shown are cols. 1vo-4vo, 10 (pls. 11-13, 10 of Thompson's edition), containing two petitions and a draft decree of judges (vso) and the end of the trial's records (col. 10). This is a copy of a memorandum with its two forwarding letters, written on the verso of the famous Siut trail report P. BM 10591. It is connected with P. BM 10591 vso.col. 3, which is a copy of the legal advice requested in one of the forwarding letters. Nos. 10575-10601 from the Siut Archive.
Curator's comments: Bibliography Depauw, The Demotic Letter (2006), 354 with proposed new readings. Felber, H., Demotische Ackerpachtverträge (ÄA 58). Wiesbaden, 1997, pg. 83. Cf. entry in www.trismegistos.org - DAHT.
Bibliographic references: Pestman 1961 / Marriage and matrimonial property in ancient Egypt : a contribution to establishing the legal position of the woman (p.43, no.1)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (43343) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/43343)
